dm:Content.dm:Paragraph: This document outlines a pre-ride inspection checklist for mountain bikes, designed to ensure safety and optimal performance. It is based on the provided DModule and is intended for use by riders before each ride.
dm:Content.dm:Heading: I. Introduction
dm:Content.dm:Paragraph: This checklist covers key components of a mountain bike. Regular inspection and maintenance are crucial for a safe and enjoyable riding experience.
dm:Content.dm:Heading: II. Inspection Checklist
A. Brakes

dm:List.dm:ListItem: Pads: Check for wear and tear. Replace if necessary.
Levers: Ensure smooth operation and proper adjustment.
Cables/Hydraulic Lines: Inspect for fraying, kinks, or leaks.

dm:Content.dm:Heading: B. Tires

dm:List.dm:ListItem: Pressure: Inflate to the recommended pressure based on terrain:
Off-Road: 35-40 lbs
On-Road: 55-60 lbs
Condition: Inspect for cracks, splits, or embedded objects.

dm:Content.dm:Heading: C. Wheels

dm:List.dm:ListItem: Bearings: Check for looseness or roughness.
Trueness: Ensure the wheel spins without significant wobble.
Spokes: Verify all spokes are present and tight.
Axel Nuts: Confirm they are securely tightened.

dm:Content.dm:Heading: D. Headset

dm:List.dm:ListItem: Bearings: Check for looseness or roughness.

dm:Content.dm:Heading: E. Chain

dm:List.dm:ListItem: Links: Ensure smooth movement and proper lubrication.

dm:Content.dm:Heading: F. Handlebar & Stem

dm:List.dm:ListItem: Stem: Inspect for cracks. **If cracked, replace immediately.**
Tightness: Confirm stem and handlebar clamp bolts are securely tightened. **If handlebars twist in the stem, tighten the clamp bolt.**

dm:Content.dm:Heading: G. Computer (if equipped)

dm:List.dm:ListItem: Display: Verify functionality and accurate readings.
Altitude: 0 miles
Speed: 0 mph
Distance: 0 miles

dm:Content.dm:Heading: III. Warnings & Cautions

dm:List.dm:ListItem: Do not ride with a cracked stem.
Always replace a cracked stem immediately.

dm:Content.dm:Heading: IV. Additional Notes

dm:List.dm:ListItem: This checklist is a general guide. Consult your bike manufacturer's manual for specific recommendations.
Regular maintenance and professional servicing are recommended to ensure optimal performance and safety.
Adjust this inspection to your riding conditions and skill level.
